org.smartfrog.services.anubis.basiccomms.connectiontransport
Class ConnectionComms

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.smartfrog.services.anubis.basiccomms.connectiontransport.ConnectionComms
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, WireSizes
Direct Known Subclasses:
MessageConnectionImpl, TestConnection, TestConnection
public abstract class ConnectionComms
extends java.lang.Thread
implements WireSizes

The ConnectionComms class is an abstract base class for connection endpoints. The endpoint is used to send and receive objects using object streams over a tcp connection. There are two methods to be implemented: deliverObject is called to handle objects revceived over the connection; is called to indicates that the connection is being closed. Connection closure can occur in response to a remote end closure, a local end closure (shutdown method) or an exception while sending or receving an object.

Constructor Detail

ConnectionComms

public ConnectionComms(java.lang.String threadName,
                       ConnectionAddress address)
constructor - creates a tcp connection with the remote address provided as a parameter. If the constructor fails to create the tcp connection it will result in a connection comms object in the closed state: connected() returns false.

ConnectionComms

public ConnectionComms(java.lang.String threadName,
                       java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel)
constructor - used to create a ConnectionComms object for an existing tcp socket connection. This is typically used by a connection factory when a ConnectionServer object receives a connection request.

Method Detail

closing

public abstract void closing()
called to indicate that the tcp connection is closing. Not called if the constructor initially fails - i.e. the connection was never open.

deliver

public abstract void deliver(byte[] bytes)
deliverObject is called to deliver an object received on this connection.

send

public void send(byte[] bytes)
used to send an object on this connection

shutdown

public void shutdown()
used to terminate this connection

connected

public boolean connected()
returns the state of this connection. Synchronized to avoid reading the status while it is changing.

run

public void run()
The receive object loop forms the main thread loop. When an object is received it is delivered. If the connection is closed at the other end or the read fails the connection is terminated.
